title: forwarding junk mail from Thunderbird to official govt. reporting site
content:
I'm in the UK, I've been forwarding all my junk email to The National Cyber Security Centre,

https://www.gov.uk/report-suspicious-emails-websites-phishing

I've put their reporting email address into my contacts and have been manually forwarding each junk email as it arrives, they're happy to accept anything suspicious, they say send as much as you like!

https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/collection/phishing-scams/report-scam-email

"If you have received an email which you’re not quite sure about, forward it to report@phishing.gov.uk Forward us as many suspicious emails as you like. Send us emails that feel suspicious, even if you're not certain they're a scam - we can check."

the combination of adding each junk mail senders address to the 'block sender and domain' list in Outlook, plus forwarding each junk mail to the NCSC seems to have completely killed my junk mail problem,

what I'd like to know is: if there is a way of setting up items that arrive in the junk mail folder to automatically forward to this address, or: could a feature be added to Thunderbird where you could set up automatic forwarding of junk, a box where you fill in the appropriate reporting address for your region/country?

title: Group By Sort breaks sorting by date
content:
I switched to Thunderbird 115 Supernova a couple of months ago. All was well for some weeks, but then a weird problem developed.

I've always used Group By Sort, a huge help in organizing my endless flow of email. But now, when I enable Group By Sort, Thunderbird randomly mixes new and old messages - the list shows recent messages from 2023, then skips to 2022, then goes back to 2023 again. (See attached image.) I can't see any pattern to it. This problem affects all my email folders and sub-folders.

I've tried all the obvious things - changing sort direction and column, using Repair Folder from the Properties dialog, etc. My only fallback at this point is to use Unthreaded view, which seems to sort correctly.

Needless to say, this is incredibly annoying. I was hoping Supernova would improve my life, instead it seems to have broken one of my favorite features. (My last resort will be to revert to pre-Supernova Thunderbird... if that's even possible.)

I've searched up and down the Internet, can't find any discussion of this problem. Can anyone help with this?
